meanings.definition: to deforest, to bald, to make bald
meanings.english_definition: to remove the trees from an area of land; to make something bald.

examples.sentence: Mereka menggundulkan hutan untuk membuka lahan pertanian.
examples.translation: They deforested the forest to open up agricultural land.
The disease made his head bald.

meanings.english_definition: to cut down all the trees in an area.
meanings.notes: Often used in the context of environmental damage.

etymology.value: Derived from the root word 'gundul' (bald, bare) with the prefix 'meng-' (to make, to do) and suffix '-kan' (causative).

usage_notes.explanation: This word is often used in the context of deforestation and environmental issues. It implies a complete removal of trees or hair.

readability_explanation.text: This word is relatively specific and related to environmental issues or physical appearance. It is not a common word in everyday conversation.

example_sentences.sentence: Aktivitas ilegal menggundulkan banyak hutan di Indonesia.
example_sentences.translation: Illegal activities are deforesting many forests in Indonesia.
The cancer made his hair fall out (made him bald).
